The checklist includes **Full Quantum Resistance**, **ZK-EVM scalability via PeerDAS**, and **Account Abstraction**. Keone Hon from **Monad** immediately mapped these requirements to Monad's own roadmap, highlighting that while they've hit the TPS and state architecture goals, they‚Äîand the rest of the industry‚Äîstill lag on decentralized block building and PQC.

### Vertical Integration: Polygon‚Äôs $250M+ Power Move

By integrating licensed U.S. fiat ramps (48 states) with Sequence's embedded wallet and **Trails orchestration**, Polygon is building a "vertical money stack." This effectively bypasses traditional correspondent banking hurdles, positioning **Polygon** as the primary rail for institutional stablecoin settlement and PayFi.

![Polygon Open Money Stack Architecture](https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1768320755/veldt/daca4tnqb3qtz9gwodh5.jpg)

### Prediction Markets and Institutional Validation
Prediction markets are no longer a niche crypto experiment; they are becoming primary data sources for macro sentiment. **Kalshi recorded an $837M weekend volume peak** during the NFL Playoffs, while **Polymarket** continues to dominate the decentralized side with over **$238M in daily volume** on Jan 10th. The sentiment here is overwhelmingly bullish, bolstered by reports of the **Senate Banking Committee** considering amendments to allow stablecoin rewards‚Äîa move that would disproportionately benefit **Coinbase** and further institutionalize onchain yields.

![Spot Volume Comparison: Kalshi vs. Polymarket](https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1768239897/veldt/yxwblulivdl7zxdcuojg.jpg)

steps.text:
As of June 4, 2024, the cryptocurrency market is seeing a distinct "bifurcation" where legacy projects from the 2017-2021 eras are surging alongside a hyper-modern "SocialFi" trend.

Below are the top-performing tokens (Market Cap > $20M) over the last 24 hours and the narratives fueling their growth.

### **Top Performers (Market Cap > $20M)**

| Token | Ticker | 24h Growth | Market Cap | Primary Narrative |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Lisk** | LSK | **+31%** | ~$61M | Layer 2 Migration / Supply Burn |
| **AI Rig Complex** | ARC | **+32%** | ~$45M | AI / Decentralized Compute |
| **JasmyCoin** | JASMY | **+25%** | ~$1.4B | Apple-Japan Integration Rumors |
| **Alchemix** | ALCX | **+26%** | ~$30M | DeFi Yield / Governance |
| **Notcoin** | NOT | **+20%*** | ~$2.4B | Telegram SocialFi / Mass Adoption |
| **Balancer** | BAL | **+15%** | ~$51M | DeFi Infrastructure |

*\*Note: Notcoin has surged over 300% in the last 7 days; the 24h window shows continued momentum and high volatility.*

---

### **Common Themes & Narratives**

#### **1. The "Legacy Pivot" (Lisk & Jasmy)**
The strongest theme today is the **Revival of Legacy Tokens.** Both Lisk (launched in 2016) and Jasmy (founded by former Sony executives) are successfully rebranding for the 2024 cycle.
*   **Catalysts:** 
    *   **LSK:** The project is migrating from its own Layer 1 to an **Ethereum Layer 2** using Optimism‚Äôs OP Stack. This aligns Lisk with the dominant Ethereum ecosystem. Furthermore, they announced a community vote on whether to **burn 25% of the total supply**, creating a massive "deflationary" hype.
    *   **JASMY:** The "Bitcoin of Japan" narrative was supercharged by news that Japan‚Äôs "My Number" ID cards will be integrated into iPhones. While a formal Jasmy-Apple partnership is unconfirmed, the market is speculating that Jasmy‚Äôs blockchain-based data privacy tech will be the backbone of this national digital ID strategy.

#### **2. Social-Led Hyper-Growth (Notcoin)**
Notcoin represents a shift away from traditional "VC-backed" tech and toward **Distribution-First crypto.**
*   **Catalysts:** 
    *   **Telegram Integration:** By leveraging Telegram‚Äôs 900M users via a simple "tap-to-earn" game, Notcoin has achieved a level of user acquisition that DeFi protocols spend years trying to reach. 
    *   **Volume & Liquidity:** NOT is currently one of the top 5 most traded assets in the world (surpassing most Tier 1 alts). This sheer liquidity is drawing in "whale" investors who view it as the primary beta play for the TON ecosystem.

#### **3. AI Infrastructure (ARC)**
The AI narrative remains the market's "safe haven" for growth, moving in lockstep with the traditional tech sector (Nvidia).
*   **Catalysts:** Tokens like **ARC** are benefiting from the demand for decentralized compute. As AI startups struggle to secure GPU power, projects offering decentralized "rigs" or compute complexes are seeing speculative inflows.

---

### **Central Sector Analysis: "Infrastructure Re-Alignment"**

The central theme among these gainers is **Infrastructure Re-Alignment.** 

**Why it‚Äôs happening now:**
We are currently in a period of "Altcoin Rotation." As Bitcoin consolidates near $70k, capital is moving into projects that provide **tangible utility or massive distribution.**

*   **Institutional/Government Validation:** The JASMY pump is driven by the idea of blockchain being used for **state-level identification.** This is a pivot from "speculative" crypto to "utility" crypto.
*   **Ethereum Alignment:** Lisk‚Äôs move to become an L2 shows that older L1s have realized that "going it alone" is no longer viable; the future belongs to the **Ethereum Superchain.**
*   **Social Distribution:** Notcoin has proved that the best way to launch a token in 2024 isn't through a whitepaper, but through a **social funnel** (Telegram).

**Summary Catalyst:** The market is rewarding projects that can prove they have **real users** (NOT) or **national-level utility** (JASMY), while punishing stagnant projects that refuse to migrate to modern tech stacks (LSK).

*   **Catalysts:** 
    *   **Telegram Integration:** By leveraging Telegram‚Äôs 900M users via a simple "tap-to-earn" game, Notcoin has achieved a level of user acquisition that DeFi protocols spend years trying to reach. 
    *   **Volume & Liquidity:** NOT is currently one of the top 5 most traded assets in the world (surpassing most Tier 1 alts). This sheer liquidity is drawing in "whale" investors who view it as the primary beta play for the TON ecosystem.

#### **3. AI Infrastructure (ARC)**
The AI narrative remains the market's "safe haven" for growth, moving in lockstep with the traditional tech sector (Nvidia).
*   **Catalysts:** Tokens like **ARC** are benefiting from the demand for decentralized compute. As AI startups struggle to secure GPU power, projects offering decentralized "rigs" or compute complexes are seeing speculative inflows.

---

### **Central Sector Analysis: "Infrastructure Re-Alignment"**

The central theme among these gainers is **Infrastructure Re-Alignment.** 

**Why it‚Äôs happening now:**
We are currently in a period of "Altcoin Rotation." As Bitcoin consolidates near $70k, capital is moving into projects that provide **tangible utility or massive distribution.**

*   **Institutional/Government Validation:** The JASMY pump is driven by the idea of blockchain being used for **state-level identification.** This is a pivot from "speculative" crypto to "utility" crypto.
*   **Ethereum Alignment:** Lisk‚Äôs move to become an L2 shows that older L1s have realized that "going it alone" is no longer viable; the future belongs to the **Ethereum Superchain.**
*   **Social Distribution:** Notcoin has proved that the best way to launch a token in 2024 isn't through a whitepaper, but through a **social funnel** (Telegram).

**Summary Catalyst:** The market is rewarding projects that can prove they have **real users** (NOT) or **national-level utility** (JASMY), while punishing stagnant projects that refuse to migrate to modern tech stacks (LSK).

question.query: analyze the projects with the greatest mindshare growth over the last 24h - what are the common themes and narratives driving it? Is there a central sector or them among them, and if so, analyze what catalysts are driving it

steps.text:
Summary (quick): across the leaderboards I checked (CoinGecko Trending / Highlights, Santiment Social Trends, LunarCrush category/alt-rank pages and CoinMarketCap Trending), the tokens that show the largest short‚Äëterm ‚Äúmindshare‚Äù spikes over the past 24h are dominated by three overlapping narratives: 1) AI / AI‚Äëagent projects, 2) memecoins / NFT community plays, and 3) RWA / listings & ETF‚Äëadjacent stories. Those narratives ‚Äî and the catalysts that drive them ‚Äî explain most of the recent surges in social volume and search interest.

Which projects showed the biggest 24h mindshare spikes (examples from the sources)
- EVAA Protocol, ChainOpera AI (COAI), Limitless (LMTS), Turtle ‚Äî showed up on CoinGecko‚Äôs trending/highlight lists (high searches & large 24h social/price moves). (CoinGecko Trending / Highlights)
- Pudgy Penguins, Aster, other NFT/meme tokens were also in CoinGecko‚Äôs trending list. (CoinGecko)
- Santiment callouts in recent ‚Äútop trending‚Äù writeups include meme coins like $TROLL and launch/airdrop/whale‚Äëdriven tokens such as Towns Protocol (TOWNS) ‚Äî examples of meme/whale/listing driven spikes. (Santiment Social Trends / Insights)
- LunarCrush‚Äôs public pages show categories with the strongest interaction growth are ‚ÄúAI Agents‚Äù, ‚ÄúRWA Protocols‚Äù, and meme/NFT categories ‚Äî LunarCrush also ranks projects by social dominance and interaction spikes. (LunarCrush)

Common themes / core narratives driving mindshare growth
1. AI & ‚ÄúAI agent‚Äù tokens
- Why they trend: broad excitement about on‚Äëchain AI, integrations with LLMs, launches of ‚ÄúAI agent‚Äù ecosystems or tokenized AI tooling, plus hype from mainstream AI news cycles.
- How it plays out: token announcements, demo releases, partnerships with known AI projects, or listing of AI‚Äërelated tokens trigger large search and social spikes (people equate ‚ÄúAI + crypto‚Äù with big upside).

2. Meme / NFT / community tokens
- Why they trend: low market‚Äëcap assets can spike fast from viral social campaigns, influencer pushes, or concentrated whale buys. NFT brands that announce token launches or ecosystem moves also spike.
- How it plays out: viral X/Twitter posts, coordinated buying, possible promises of listings/airdrops and quick price moves attract further attention (feedback loop of FOMO ‚Üí coverage ‚Üí more attention).

3. Real‚ÄëWorld Assets (RWA) / exchange/listing / ETF adjacent narratives
- Why they trend: news around RWA products, tokenization of treasuries, or ETF approvals/flows can push several related tokens into the spotlight. Likewise, rumors/confirmations of major exchange listings create immediate search/activity spikes.
- How it plays out: regulatory or institutional news (ETF flows, treasury buys) and exchange listing announcements drive coordinated interest across social + search.

Is there a single central sector? Short answer: not one single sector, but two dominant strands
- The clearest concentration right now is AI‚Äërelated projects (AI agents, infrastructure, and tokenized AI utilities). That sector shows consistent social momentum across the platforms I checked.
- Memecoin/NFT momentum runs in parallel and frequently produces the largest single‚Äëtoken spikes because of the low liquidity / high viral potential.
- RWA/ETF/listing narratives often act as a secondary wave that lifts mid‚Äëcap projects.

Primary catalysts that produce 24h mindshare surges
- Product / demo launches and ‚Äúfirst look‚Äù announcements for AI features or agent marketplaces.
- Exchange listings or leak/rumor of listings on major exchanges (Coinbase / Binance), which drive instant search and volume spikes.
- Influencer / viral X (Twitter) threads or coordinated social campaigns ‚Äî memecoins especially benefit.
- Token airdrops / claim mechanics announced (or rumored) ‚Äî historically huge drivers of social growth.
- Whale accumulation and on‚Äëchain transfers, often spotted and amplified by trackers/alerts.
- Institutional / macro news (ETF approvals, treasury allocations into crypto, regulatory rulings) that lift multiple related tokens.
- Partnerships with recognizable Web2/AI brands or developer tooling integrations (these lend legitimacy and media coverage).

Short analysis of why these catalysts matter for mindshare (brief)
- Social metrics react faster than price charts: a single tweet or listing notice can raise search volume and social dominance within minutes; the markets follow or amplify the story.
- AI is a durable macro narrative at present: mainstream AI coverage provides a recurring tailwind; when a project ties itself credibly to AI, it gets disproportionate attention.
- Memecoins/NFTs create the largest amplitude spikes because of network effects and low liquidity: social push ‚Üí price spike ‚Üí more coverage ‚Üí higher mindshare.

What to monitor to confirm / quantify mindshare movers
- Santiment / LunarCrush: social volume, social dominance, engagement, and sentiment changes.
- CoinGecko / CoinMarketCap trending pages and ‚Äúmost searched‚Äù lists.
- X (Twitter) trending mentions and top threads (look for high‚Äëengagement tweets).
- On‚Äëchain signals: whale transfers, sudden exchange inflows/outflows, active addresses.
- Google Trends for search interest, and aggregator feeds (CryptoPanic, Reddit top posts).

If you want live, actionable output
- I can fetch a live top‚Äë10 list of tokens with the largest social‚Äëvolume increases in the last 24 hours from Santiment / LunarCrush / CoinGecko and produce a ranked list + one‚Äëline catalyst notes for each (e.g., ‚Äúlisted on X / airdrop announced / influencer push / product demo‚Äù). Tell me which sources you prefer (Santiment, LunarCrush, CoinGecko, CoinMarketCap, or X), and I‚Äôll pull the real‚Äëtime list now.

Would you like me to fetch the live top‚Äë10 movers and give per‚Äëtoken catalyst + a short trade‚Äë/watchlist recommendation?

steps.text:
The greatest mindshare growth in the last 24 hours is dominated by the **AI Agent Economy** and a new sub-sector referred to as **"Culture-Tech" Memes.** 

According to social dominance data from platforms like Kaito and LunarCrush, mindshare is rotating away from traditional Altcoins and toward autonomous agents and high-sentiment narrative coins.

### 1. Top Projects by Mindshare Growth
The following projects have seen the most significant spikes in social engagement, developer interest, and volume over the last 24 hours:

*   **ACT (Act I: The AI Prophecy):** Massive growth following a recent Binance listing; it serves as a decentralized "collider" for AI agents.
*   **Virtuals Protocol (VIRTUAL):** A launchpad/infrastructure protocol for AI agents on Base. It has gained mindshare as the "Pump.fun for AI agents."
*   **ai16z (AI16Z):** A venture-fund-styled DAO governed by an AI agent. It represents the "Agentic VC" narrative.
*   **GOAT (Goatseus Maximus):** The "blue chip" of AI memes, which continues to dominate mindshare as the pioneer of autonomous AI-driven cult movements.
*   **PNUT (Peanut the Squirrel):** While not purely AI, its mindshare growth is explosive due to a "Culture War" narrative sparked by viral news and Elon Musk‚Äôs public commentary.

---

### 2. Common Themes and Narratives
Several distinct themes are driving this growth:

*   **The "Agentic Web":** Moving beyond "chatbots," these projects feature AI agents with their own wallets and X (Twitter) accounts that can autonomously trade, launch tokens, and build communities.
*   **Fair Launch & Decentralization:** Unlike the VC-heavy coins of 2024, many of these (like ACT and GOAT) gained mindshare through organic community takeovers or fair launches, appealing to a retail market tired of "low float, high FDV" (Fully Diluted Valuation) tokens.
*   **AI x SocialFi:** The narrative that "AI is the new social layer." Agents are no longer just tools; they are influencers and community leaders.

---

### 3. Central Sector: The AI Agent Economy
The central sector is undeniably **AI Agents (DeAI).** This sector has seen a **40%+ increase in total mindshare** within the last 24 hours, dwarfing Layer 1s and DeFi protocols.

#### Key Catalysts Driving the AI Agent Sector:
1.  **Exchange Listings (The "Binance Effect"):** The listing of **ACT** and **PNUT** on Binance acted as a massive liquidity bridge. This signaled to the market that "AI Agents" and "Culture Memes" are now considered legitimate, high-growth categories by top-tier exchanges.
2.  **Infrastructure Maturity:** The rise of **Virtuals Protocol** on Base has made it incredibly easy for users to create and trade AI agents, leading to a "long tail" of agent tokens similar to the memecoin craze on Solana.
3.  **Proof of Autonomy:** The "Truth Terminal" (the agent behind GOAT) proved that an AI can create significant economic value ($1B+ market cap) without human intervention. This has led to a "gold rush" of developers trying to build the next autonomous agent.
4.  **The "Agentic VC" Trend:** Projects like **ai16z** are testing a new model where an AI agent manages a treasury and makes investment decisions based on community sentiment, a narrative that combines DeFi with AI in a novel way.

### Summary for Investors
The current trend suggests a shift from **passive assets** (coins that just exist on a chain) to **active assets** (AI agents that interact, post, and trade). The "Agentic Meta" is currently the most crowded and high-growth sector, fueled by the intersection of LLM technology and crypto-incentives.

*   **Fair Launch & Decentralization:** Unlike the VC-heavy coins of 2024, many of these (like ACT and GOAT) gained mindshare through organic community takeovers or fair launches, appealing to a retail market tired of "low float, high FDV" (Fully Diluted Valuation) tokens.
*   **AI x SocialFi:** The narrative that "AI is the new social layer." Agents are no longer just tools; they are influencers and community leaders.

---

### 3. Central Sector: The AI Agent Economy
The central sector is undeniably **AI Agents (DeAI).** This sector has seen a **40%+ increase in total mindshare** within the last 24 hours, dwarfing Layer 1s and DeFi protocols.

#### Key Catalysts Driving the AI Agent Sector:
1.  **Exchange Listings (The "Binance Effect"):** The listing of **ACT** and **PNUT** on Binance acted as a massive liquidity bridge. This signaled to the market that "AI Agents" and "Culture Memes" are now considered legitimate, high-growth categories by top-tier exchanges.
2.  **Infrastructure Maturity:** The rise of **Virtuals Protocol** on Base has made it incredibly easy for users to create and trade AI agents, leading to a "long tail" of agent tokens similar to the memecoin craze on Solana.
3.  **Proof of Autonomy:** The "Truth Terminal" (the agent behind GOAT) proved that an AI can create significant economic value ($1B+ market cap) without human intervention. This has led to a "gold rush" of developers trying to build the next autonomous agent.
4.  **The "Agentic VC" Trend:** Projects like **ai16z** are testing a new model where an AI agent manages a treasury and makes investment decisions based on community sentiment, a narrative that combines DeFi with AI in a novel way.

### Summary for Investors
The current trend suggests a shift from **passive assets** (coins that just exist on a chain) to **active assets** (AI agents that interact, post, and trade). The "Agentic Meta" is currently the most crowded and high-growth sector, fueled by the intersection of LLM technology and crypto-incentives.

question.query: analyze the crypto agent market - which protocols are gaining traction and why

steps.text:
Short answer
- The agent/automation layer is maturing fast. Protocols gaining the most real traction right now are: Chainlink Automation (on‚Äëchain scheduling/keepers), Gelato (automation + agent frameworks/plugins), dedicated ‚Äúagent platforms/marketplaces‚Äù (Autonolas / Olas and similar projects), agent SDKs/OS projects (StateSet, Cortex, Open AEA / Open Autonomy), and decentralized AI / compute/data stacks that enable agents (Fetch.ai, Render, Ocean, Bittensor).  
- Why: broad developer integrations, robust execution guarantees (oracles/relayers), token/incentive models and marketplaces for agents, standards work (discovery/trust), plus integrations with LLMs/compute. See sources at the end.

Deeper analysis

1) Categories to watch (and the leading names)
- On‚Äëchain automation / reliable execution
  - Chainlink Automation (Keepers ‚Üí Automation, OCR3, CRE): high reliability, multi‚Äëchain support, widely used for recurring jobs and triggers. Developers migrate existing upkeeps to newer registries and Chainlink continues to add tooling (Chainlink Runtime Environment). Evidence: Chainlink docs and migration notices.  
  - Gelato Network: general-purpose automation, growing plugins for AI agents (ElizaOS / Gelato plugin). Gelato is used for task execution, gas-relays and agent-triggered transactions across EVM chains.

- Agent marketplaces, ownership & coordination layers
  - Autonolas / Olas (OLAS): projects explicitly building an ‚Äúagent economy‚Äù with agent registries, marketplaces and token coordination (agent app stores, mech marketplaces). Olas/Autonolas public docs and blogs highlight millions of agent-to-agent transactions and marketplace features.
  - Other marketplace-ish entrants: Autonomys, Virtuals/DIRA and similar projects that package agents as composable, monetizable units.

- Agent SDKs / Agent OS (developer tooling)
  - Open Autonomy / Open AEA (Autonolas), StateSet (Agentic OS), Cortex Agent Platform: frameworks for building multi‚Äëagent systems, composition, and secure off‚Äëchain/on‚Äëchain coordination. These are important because developer productivity (SDKs, templates, secure coordination) is a leading adoption driver.

- Decentralized AI compute / data & model marketplaces (enabling infrastructure)
  - Fetch.ai (autonomous economic agents, own chain/Cosmos SDK), Render Network, Ocean Protocol, Bittensor: provide data, inference/compute or agent execution infrastructure so agents can run useful tasks without relying solely on centralized clouds.

- Standards & primitives
  - ERC‚Äë8004 (Trustless Agents standard, published/announced Aug 2025): attempts to codify agent discovery, capability advertisement, identity/reputation primitives. Standards accelerate interoperability and marketplace liquidity.

2) Why these protocols are winning adoption (the main drivers)
- Reliability & execution guarantees: agents must execute on chain or trigger transactions safely and timely. Chainlink and Gelato provide production‚Äëgrade execution, monitoring and multi‚Äënode redundancy ‚Äî exactly what DeFi/DAO workflows need.
- Developer experience & integration: SDKs, templates, and plugins (Open AEA, StateSet, ElizaOS + Gelato plugin) reduce the friction to build multi‚Äëagent apps and attach them to smart contracts.
- Marketplaces & token economics: projects that let users own/stake/monetize agents (Olas/Autonolas) create clearer business models and network effects: creators monetize agents, users buy agent services, stakers secure reputation/incentives.
- On‚Äëchain identity/reputation & discovery: agents that can find and evaluate counterparties (standards like ERC‚Äë8004) remove bespoke integrations and open composability.
- Cross‚Äëstack integration with AI: connection to LLMs, decentralized inference, oracles (Chainlink Functions, data feeds) gives agents the perceptual and reasoning capabilities they need.
- Gas abstraction & UX: relayers / gasless UX (Gelato Relay, other relayers) make agents usable by ordinary users and enable continuous background activity without awkward UX.

3) Evidence / traction signals (examples from public docs & posts)
- Chainlink Automation: active docs, v2.1+ migration and CRE tooling show continued product investment and widespread usage.
- Gelato: formal docs on ‚ÄúAI Agents‚Äù and ElizaOS plugin indicate positioning as an agent execution layer.
- Fetch.ai: project metrics reported publicly (mainnet transactions, active wallets, staking figures) and ecosystem activity signal real usage of decentralized agent ideas.
- Olas / Autonolas: documentation and posts claiming millions of A2A (agent-to-agent) transactions and a live marketplace indicate an active agent economy in some niches.
- ERC‚Äë8004 (Aug 2025): existence of a community standard effort is a strong network effect indicator ‚Äî standards usually follow when multiple projects need interoperability.

4) Primary use cases driving adoption today
- DeFi automation (liquidations, rebalances, strategy rollups)
- DAO automation (treasury management, proposal execution, modular governance agents)
- Trading & execution agents (TWAP, arbitrage, market‚Äëmaking run 24/7)
- Agent marketplaces (sell/hire agents for services: analytics, marketing, data aggregation)
- On‚Äëchain commerce orchestration (composing agents to execute multi‚Äëparty workflows)
- Personal ‚Äúself‚Äëdriving‚Äù wallets / assistants that manage subscriptions, taxes, and allocations

5) Risks & headwinds
- Security: autonomous agents executing economic actions raise new attack surfaces (malicious agent behavior, oracle manipulation, compromised LLM prompts).
- Economic design complexity: aligning incentives for builders, users, stakers and reputation providers is hard; poorly designed tokenomics can centralize or collapse marketplaces.
- Regulatory uncertainty: agents doing trading, custody, or financial advice may attract regulation (KYC, licensure).
- Reliance on centralized AI providers: agents that depend on proprietary LLMs or centralized inference services inherit centralization and censorship risk unless decentralized compute is used.
- UX & trust: mainstream users need clear assurances (auditability, explainability) before delegating funds/decisions to autonomous agents.

6) Short‚Äëterm outlook (6‚Äì18 months) ‚Äî what I expect
- Continued growth in hybrid stacks: Chainlink/Gelato for execution + agent SDKs/marketplaces (Autonolas/Olas/StateSet) for composition. Projects that combine execution guarantees with easy developer tooling will outperform.
- Standards like ERC‚Äë8004 will push agent discovery & reputation adoption, improving cross‚Äëplatform liquidity for agent services.
- Decentralized compute/data providers (Fetch.ai, Render, Ocean) will be increasingly integrated so agents can be ‚Äúfully on‚Äëchain‚Äù or verifiably decentralized where needed.
- Security tooling and audit patterns for agents will emerge rapidly (formal verification of agent contracts, attestation frameworks).

7) Practical recommendations
- If you‚Äôre building: pick an execution backbone (Chainlink Automation or Gelato) and a composable agent SDK (Open AEA / StateSet / Cortex) ‚Äî prioritise interoperability with standards (ERC‚Äë8004) and a plugin strategy for LLM/compute.
- If you‚Äôre investing or scouting: favor projects with (a) production integrations into DeFi/DAO stacks, (b) live marketplaces or transaction volume, and (c) clear token/incentive mechanics for agent creators and stakers.
- If you‚Äôre a DAO/operator: start with low‚Äërisk automation (accounting, payroll, periodic rebalances) using established automation services, then pilot agent marketplaces for incremental monetization.

Key links / sources (representative)
- Chainlink Automation docs: https://docs.chain.link/chainlink-automation
- Gelato AI agents / ElizaOS plugin: https://docs.gelato.network/web3-services/ai-agents
- Autonolas / Olas docs and blogs: https://docs.autonolas.network and https://olas.network
- Fetch.ai product/blog summary (2024/2025 review): https://fetch.ai/blog/fetch-ai-2024
- ERC‚Äë8004 (Trustless Agents standard announcement): https://8004.org
- StateSet docs (Agentic OS): https://docs.stateset.com/stateset-agentic-os
- Cortex Agent Platform docs: https://docs.cortexprotocol.com/docs/AgentPlatform

If you want, I can:
- produce a matrix comparing the leading protocols on adoption metrics, dev tooling, execution guarantees, token model and composability; or
- drill into one category (e.g., automation layers vs. marketplaces) and recommend concrete integration patterns for a specific use case (DAO treasury, market‚Äëmaking agents, agent marketplace). Which would you prefer?

steps.text:
The crypto AI agent market has evolved from simple chatbots into a complex ecosystem of **autonomous entities** capable of managing assets, executing on-chain transactions, and dominating social media attention. In Q4 2024, the market cap of AI agent tokens surged by over **222%**, reaching approximately $15.5 billion.

The market is currently bifurcated between two primary ecosystems: **Solana** (the hub for memetic and retail-driven agents) and **Base** (the hub for infrastructure and functional agent commerce).

---

### 1. Protocols Gaining Traction (The "Big Three" Frameworks)

The market is currently dominated by frameworks that allow developers to "spawn" agents with pre-built capabilities.

#### **A. ai16z (The ElizaOS Framework)**
*   **Traction:** Currently the market leader with ~60% mindshare. Its open-source framework, **Eliza**, has become the "standard" for social-media-active agents.
*   **Why:** Eliza provides a plug-and-play architecture for agents to interact on Twitter, Discord, and Telegram while managing a crypto wallet. Its association with high-profile "Agentic VC" experiments (like the ai16z DAO) has made it the primary choice for developers on Solana.

#### **B. Virtuals Protocol (The GAME Framework)**
*   **Traction:** The undisputed leader on the **Base** ecosystem, commanding over 90% of daily active agent wallets there.
*   **Why:** Virtuals offers a "Launchpad" model where agents are tokenized and their cognitive abilities (the GAME framework) are modular. Their star agent, **aixbt**, became a top-tier influencer, proving that agents can provide high-value alpha and technical analysis to human traders.

#### **C. Autonolas (OLAS)**
*   **Traction:** A more established, "industrial-grade" protocol focusing on off-chain services.
*   **Why:** While Eliza and Virtuals focus on "personality" and trading, Olas focuses on **autonomous workflows** (e.g., prediction markets, DAO governance). Its *Olas Predict* agent is one of the most active on-chain entities, consistently generating revenue through decentralized prediction markets.

---

### 2. Emerging "Dark Horses"
*   **Zerebro (ZerePy):** A python-based framework that allows agents to be "cross-chain" and "cross-platform" natively. It has gained a niche following for its technical flexibility.
*   **Wayfinder (Parallel):** Focusing on the gaming sector, Wayfinder agents are designed to navigate complex smart contracts to "play" games and optimize yield for users.
*   **vvaifu.fun:** A Solana-based launchpad that simplifies the creation of "waifu" (anime-themed) agents, tapping into the massive retail intersection of AI and memecoins.

---

### 3. Key Market Drivers: Why the Sudden Traction?

1.  **From Chatbots to "Agentic Workflows":** Unlike the "AI coins" of 2023 which were mostly wrappers for ChatGPT, 2024-2025 agents can **sign transactions**. They have their own wallets and can buy/sell tokens autonomously based on their own internal logic.
2.  **Social Media Viral Loops:** Agents like **Goatseus Maximus (GOAT)**‚Äîwhich originated from the *Truth Terminal* AI‚Äîproved that an autonomous agent could create a cult-like following and a billion-dollar market cap without human intervention.
3.  **Low Barrier to Entry (Launchpads):** Platforms like **Virtuals** and **pump.fun** have lowered the cost of launching an agent to nearly zero. This has led to an explosion of "agentic memecoins."
4.  **The "AI-Fi" (AI Finance) Shift:** We are seeing the rise of **AI DAOs**, where an agent serves as the investment officer. Investors buy the agent's token, and the agent uses those funds to trade, with profits theoretically accruing back to the token holders.

---

### 4. Ecosystem Comparison

| Feature | **Solana** | **Base (Coinbase L2)** |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Dominant Vibe** | Memetic, Viral, Retail-heavy | Infrastructure, Gaming, Functional |
| **Top Platform** | ai16z / ElizaOS | Virtuals Protocol |
| **Leading Agents** | GOAT, ZEREBRO, FARTCOIN | aixbt, VIRTUAL |
| **Strength** | High liquidity & mindshare | Low fees & integration with Coinbase |

### Summary for Researchers
If you are tracking this market, watch the **developer adoption** of the **Eliza framework** on GitHub. It is currently the "TCP/IP" of the agent world. For pure financial metrics, monitor the **DEX volume** on Virtuals Protocol (Base), as it represents the most sustainable "agent commerce" model currently active.

agentResults.finalAnswer:
The crypto agent market is shifting from "AI-themed memecoins" to functional **agentic commerce** and **autonomous finance**. The move is driven by the maturation of three layers: payment rails (x402), verifiable intelligence (TEEs/FHE), and standardized commerce protocols (UCP).

### The Payment Layer: x402 and Micropayments
Agents cannot use traditional banking; they need HTTP-native micropayments. **Coinbase** and **PayAI** (on **SKALE**) are the current leaders in the **x402** standard, which enables pay-per-call USDC settlement. PayAI recently reported over **28 million transactions** and **$7 million in settled volume**, proving that machine-to-machine economies are moving beyond prototypes. While speculative "gamed" volume exists‚ÄîArtemis data shows up to 60% gamed volume on some servers‚Äîorganic service volume for data and AI API calls now accounts for roughly **86% of total dollar value**.

https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1767821482/veldt/lkou9va0irrysoamd4be.jpg

### The Intelligence Layer: Bittensor and Allora
For agents to execute high-stakes financial tasks, their "thinking" must be verifiable. **Bittensor (TAO)** remains the dominant decentralized compute protocol, recently buoyed by **Grayscale‚Äôs ETF filing** and the launch of specialized subnets like **Loosh (SN78)**, which provides a cognition layer with "moral evaluators." **Allora** is gaining traction by launching its mainnet on **Monad**, providing predictive inferences specifically for pro-active DeFi and agent apps. Unlike generic LLMs, these protocols focus on **verifiable inference** through Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) and Zero-Knowledge proofs, which are mandatory for agents managing funded wallets.

https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1767821483/veldt/w2qux9a93dbnfgafgogh.jpg

### The Application Layer: Virtuals and Agentic Finance
**Virtuals Protocol** is the current standard for agent-native finance, facilitating the launch of agents with autonomous trading missions. We are seeing a structural shift toward **agentic finance** where agents trade prediction markets (e.g., **Polymarket** tools like PolyBro) or manage stablecoin yields (e.g., **Fraction AI‚Äôs** Signature Agents on **Base**). On **Solana**, projects like **PsyopAnime** and **Claude-Mem** are seeing massive **trader growth (+579%)**, though these remain higher-beta, narrative-driven plays. The real traction is in **UCP (Universal Commerce Protocol)**, co-developed by **Google and Shopify**, which allows agents to execute full commerce lifecycles‚Äîdiscovery to checkout‚Äîusing onchain rails.

https://res.cloudinary.com/dgjriemfd/image/upload/v1767199455/veldt/x3fmugxz1356v8mqmomg.jpg

### Infrastructure Pivots: The "AI Factory" Meta
A major tailwind for the sector is the pivot of Bitcoin miners like **Hut 8**, **Riot**, and **Bitfarms** toward **AI/HPC infrastructure**. Hut 8‚Äôs **$7 billion deal** with Fluidstack and AlphaTON‚Äôs **$46 million purchase** of NVIDIA B300 chips for the **Cocoon AI** network on **TON** show that the bottleneck is no longer just code, but the raw compute needed to power these agents. Expect the most durable protocols to be those that successfully bridge the **GPU scarcity** with onchain coordination.

question.query: What is the core trends on solana vs base? Which is more sustainable and rooted in moat-like characteristics?

steps.text:
Short answer
- Base‚Äôs core trend: rapid L2 adoption driven by Coinbase distribution, EVM compatibility, and Ethereum security ‚Äî it‚Äôs becoming a mainstream-friendly L2 focused on DeFi, gaming, and a creator/consumer product stack (Base App). Its moat is commercial (Coinbase + fiat on/off, custody, regulatory posture) plus Ethereum composability.
- Solana‚Äôs core trend: continued growth in high-throughput use cases (NFTs, gaming, high-frequency trading, micropayments) enabled by very low latency/fees and a fast runtime. Its moat is largely technical (performance & developer momentum) and community-driven, but it faces durability questions because of reliability and centralization vectors.
- Which is more sustainable/moaty? For long-term, institutionally resilient ‚Äúmoats‚Äù (distribution, regulatory positioning, secured base-layer guarantee, easy onboarding), Base looks stronger. For raw performance-driven product moats (novel apps that require throughput) Solana still leads ‚Äî but that moat is more fragile.

Comparison by key dimensions

1) Security & Settlement
- Base: A true L2 built on the OP stack; inherits Ethereum security model (final settlement on Ethereum). That reduces systemic risk for value-bearing DeFi apps and makes it easier to attract protocols that need strong guarantees.
- Solana: Native chain with its own PoH+PoS consensus. High throughput but a history of outages and edge-case bugs has created real operational risk that projects must manage.

2) Decentralization & governance
- Base: Relatively central initially (Coinbase-led) but benefits from open-source OP stack and EVM tooling. Governance/monetization decisions may reflect Coinbase‚Äôs regulatory constraints.
- Solana: Larger validator set than in the early days but still has higher infrastructure centralization risks (heavy reliance on specific node operators/hosters; higher hardware requirements). Outages have raised questions about liveness under stress.

3) Developer experience & portability
- Base: EVM-compatible ‚Äî easy porting from Ethereum, established tooling (Hardhat, Foundry, Metamask), huge composability with existing DeFi stacks. Faster developer onboarding, lower friction for teams and audits.
- Solana: Different programming model (Rust/BPF, Sealevel), steeper learning curve, but unique performance primitives. Great for apps that can‚Äôt tolerate EVM constraints.

4) Distribution & user acquisition
- Base: Strong structural distribution advantage ‚Äî direct integration and marketing through Coinbase (custody, fiat rails, millions of users). That‚Äôs a durable, real-world moat for consumer apps and liquidity.
- Solana: Organic crypto-native growth (Phantom, Magic Eden, gaming ecosystems). Distribution depends on crypto-native channels; strong but narrower than Coinbase‚Äôs mainstream funnel.

5) Composability & liquidity
- Base: Immediate access to Ethereum liquidity and tooling; easy to integrate with major protocols and stablecoins (USDC). TVL and activity growth in 2024‚Äì25 shows it‚Äôs capturing serious DeFi flows.
- Solana: On-chain liquidity is concentrated within its ecosystem; excellent for low-fee/high-frequency flows but cross-chain liquidity requires bridges (added risk).

6) Monetization & tokenomics
- Base: Started without a native token; Coinbase has signaled exploration of tokenization carefully. Moat here is corporate/infrastructure monetization (revenue from apps, Coinbase integrations) rather than native token incentives ‚Äî which can be more defensible regulatory-wise.
- Solana: SOL token ties to security/staking/economics; token utility is well-established but token-driven incentives can be more volatile.

7) Reliability & operational risk
- Base: Stability benefits from simpler L2 model and continuous engineering from Coinbase/OP Stack community.
- Solana: Faster but has had multiple high-profile network interruptions across 2024‚Äì2025; these incidents weaken trust from institutional players.

What to watch (short checklist)
- Base: whether Coinbase issues a native token (and how), how they handle regulation/US-focused constraints, and how sticky Base App/creator features become for mainstream users.
- Solana: frequency and severity of outages, improvements to validator decentralization and infra robustness, and whether applications that need extreme throughput keep choosing native Solana over EVM L2 alternatives.

Practical guidance (if you have a use case)
- Building DeFi, consumer apps, or anything that benefits from direct Ethereum composability, fiat on/off ramps, or mainstream users ‚Üí Base is the safer, more sustainable choice today.
- Building ultra-low-latency order books, high-frequency trading systems, certain large-scale games or massively concurrent microtransaction apps ‚Üí Solana still offers unique technical advantages ‚Äî but budget for ops/infra mitigation and contingency plans for downtime.

Bottom line
- Base‚Äôs moat is institutional/commercial: Coinbase distribution + Ethereum security + EVM composability = a durable, defensible foundation for mainstream-facing apps.
- Solana‚Äôs moat is performance/technical: unmatched throughput and an active ecosystem that enables product types other chains struggle with ‚Äî but it‚Äôs more fragile because of reliability and centralization concerns.

If you want, I can:
- pull the latest TVL, active-user and transaction metrics for both chains (with sources), or
- give tailored advice for a specific project type you‚Äôre evaluating (NFT marketplace, game, lending protocol, consumer app). Which would you prefer?

steps.text:
The current landscape of Solana and Base represents two different philosophies of blockchain growth: Solana is the "High-Performance Execution Engine," while Base is the "Distribution & UX Funnel."

### 1. Core Trends: Where the Activity Is
| Trend Category | **Solana** (The Casino & Payment Rail) | **Base** (The Social & Retail Hub) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Primary Driver** | **Meme Coin Mania:** Driven by platforms like Pump.fun, Solana has become the global hub for retail speculation. | **SocialFi & Content:** Dominated by Farcaster (Warpcast) and Zora. It is where "Onchain Summer" lives through social engagement. |
| **Emerging Trend** | **Stablecoin Payments:** Stripe‚Äôs $1.1B acquisition of Bridge highlighted Solana‚Äôs role as the premier rail for sub-penny payments. | **AI Agents:** Base is leading the "AI-to-AI" economy, with autonomous agents transacting via Coinbase‚Äôs developer tools. |
| **Infrastructure** | **Hardware Integration:** The Saga and upcoming **Seeker** phones create a unique mobile-native ecosystem. | **Smart Wallets:** The launch of the Coinbase Smart Wallet (passkeys, gasless) has removed the "seed phrase" barrier for retail. |

---

### 2. Moat-Like Characteristics: Who has the Deeper Trench?
A "moat" in crypto is defined by network effects, switching costs, and brand trust.

*   **Solana‚Äôs Moat: Integrated Performance & Community**
    *   **Vertical Integration:** Solana‚Äôs moat is its "monolithic" stack. By controlling hardware (phones) and software (high-speed execution), they offer an experience that is technically "impossible" on other chains.
    *   **Speed as a Moat:** For high-frequency trading (HFT) and real-time gaming, Solana's low latency (400ms block times) creates a moat where developers cannot easily migrate to a slower L2 without breaking their UX.
    *   **Resilience:** After the FTX collapse, Solana‚Äôs community became one of the most battle-hardened and loyal in crypto, creating a cultural moat.

*   **Base‚Äôs Moat: Distribution & "The Coinbase Funnel"**
    *   **Distribution (The 100M+ Moat):** Base‚Äôs greatest moat is Coinbase. It has a direct pipeline to 100M+ KYC-verified users, providing an "easy button" for retail capital to flow onchain.
    *   **The Smart Wallet:** By allowing users to sign up with Biometrics (Passkeys) and sponsoring gas fees, Base is building a moat based on **frictionless UX**. Once a user is "stuck" in a seamless ecosystem, the switching cost to a complex seed-phrase chain (like Solana) becomes high.
    *   **Ethereum Alignment:** Base leverages Ethereum‚Äôs security and liquidity, making it the "safe" choice for institutions already comfortable with ETH.

---

### 3. Sustainability: Which is Rooted for the Long Term?

**Solana: Economic Sustainability via High Velocity**
Solana‚Äôs sustainability relies on **volume**. It generates massive fees from DEX activity ($550M+ monthly in peak periods). However, it faces "inflation sustainability" questions‚Äîit must maintain high transaction counts to offset the costs of hardware-intensive validation. It is a "high-burn, high-reward" model that thrives as long as it remains the fastest execution layer.

**Base: Structural Sustainability via Institutional Backing**
Base is structurally more sustainable in a traditional sense. It doesn't have its own token to subsidize; instead, it generates revenue for Coinbase and the Optimism "Superchain." 
*   **Revenue Sharing:** Base contributes a portion of its sequencer revenue to the Optimism Collective, ensuring it remains part of a larger, collaborative ecosystem.
*   **Corporate Backing:** As long as Coinbase exists, Base has a multi-billion dollar balance sheet supporting its R&D and user acquisition.

### Final Verdict: Which is more "Rooted"?
*   **Solana** is more **technologically rooted**. Its moat is built on a "better mousetrap"‚Äîa faster, cheaper engine that attracts the most aggressive and innovative developers. Its sustainability is tied to its ability to remain the undisputed king of performance.
*   **Base** is more **economically and socially rooted**. Its moat is built on the "trust and distribution" of Coinbase. If you believe the future of crypto is onboarding "the next billion" through familiar apps and social networks, Base has the more sustainable moat.

**In short:** Solana is the **Las Vegas** of crypto (fast-paced, high revenue, high risk), while Base is the **Apple Store** (controlled, user-friendly, and backed by a giant).

agentResults.finalAnswer:
The current landscape of Solana and Base represents two different philosophies of blockchain growth: Solana is the "High-Performance Execution Engine," while Base is the "Distribution & UX Funnel."

### 1. Core Trends: Where the Activity Is
| Trend Category | **Solana** (The Casino & Payment Rail) | **Base** (The Social & Retail Hub) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Primary Driver** | **Meme Coin Mania:** Driven by platforms like Pump.fun, Solana has become the global hub for retail speculation. | **SocialFi & Content:** Dominated by Farcaster (Warpcast) and Zora. It is where "Onchain Summer" lives through social engagement. |
| **Emerging Trend** | **Stablecoin Payments:** Stripe‚Äôs $1.1B acquisition of Bridge highlighted Solana‚Äôs role as the premier rail for sub-penny payments. | **AI Agents:** Base is leading the "AI-to-AI" economy, with autonomous agents transacting via Coinbase‚Äôs developer tools. |
| **Infrastructure** | **Hardware Integration:** The Saga and upcoming **Seeker** phones create a unique mobile-native ecosystem. | **Smart Wallets:** The launch of the Coinbase Smart Wallet (passkeys, gasless) has removed the "seed phrase" barrier for retail. |

---

### 2. Moat-Like Characteristics: Who has the Deeper Trench?
A "moat" in crypto is defined by network effects, switching costs, and brand trust.

*   **Solana‚Äôs Moat: Integrated Performance & Community**
    *   **Vertical Integration:** Solana‚Äôs moat is its "monolithic" stack. By controlling hardware (phones) and software (high-speed execution), they offer an experience that is technically "impossible" on other chains.
    *   **Speed as a Moat:** For high-frequency trading (HFT) and real-time gaming, Solana's low latency (400ms block times) creates a moat where developers cannot easily migrate to a slower L2 without breaking their UX.
    *   **Resilience:** After the FTX collapse, Solana‚Äôs community became one of the most battle-hardened and loyal in crypto, creating a cultural moat.

*   **Base‚Äôs Moat: Distribution & "The Coinbase Funnel"**
    *   **Distribution (The 100M+ Moat):** Base‚Äôs greatest moat is Coinbase. It has a direct pipeline to 100M+ KYC-verified users, providing an "easy button" for retail capital to flow onchain.
    *   **The Smart Wallet:** By allowing users to sign up with Biometrics (Passkeys) and sponsoring gas fees, Base is building a moat based on **frictionless UX**. Once a user is "stuck" in a seamless ecosystem, the switching cost to a complex seed-phrase chain (like Solana) becomes high.
    *   **Ethereum Alignment:** Base leverages Ethereum‚Äôs security and liquidity, making it the "safe" choice for institutions already comfortable with ETH.

---

### 3. Sustainability: Which is Rooted for the Long Term?

**Solana: Economic Sustainability via High Velocity**
Solana‚Äôs sustainability relies on **volume**. It generates massive fees from DEX activity ($550M+ monthly in peak periods). However, it faces "inflation sustainability" questions‚Äîit must maintain high transaction counts to offset the costs of hardware-intensive validation. It is a "high-burn, high-reward" model that thrives as long as it remains the fastest execution layer.

**Base: Structural Sustainability via Institutional Backing**
Base is structurally more sustainable in a traditional sense. It doesn't have its own token to subsidize; instead, it generates revenue for Coinbase and the Optimism "Superchain." 
*   **Revenue Sharing:** Base contributes a portion of its sequencer revenue to the Optimism Collective, ensuring it remains part of a larger, collaborative ecosystem.
*   **Corporate Backing:** As long as Coinbase exists, Base has a multi-billion dollar balance sheet supporting its R&D and user acquisition.

### Final Verdict: Which is more "Rooted"?
*   **Solana** is more **technologically rooted**. Its moat is built on a "better mousetrap"‚Äîa faster, cheaper engine that attracts the most aggressive and innovative developers. Its sustainability is tied to its ability to remain the undisputed king of performance.
*   **Base** is more **economically and socially rooted**. Its moat is built on the "trust and distribution" of Coinbase. If you believe the future of crypto is onboarding "the next billion" through familiar apps and social networks, Base has the more sustainable moat.

**In short:** Solana is the **Las Vegas** of crypto (fast-paced, high revenue, high risk), while Base is the **Apple Store** (controlled, user-friendly, and backed by a giant).

agentResults.finalAnswer:
As of early 2026, the divergence between **Solana** and **Base** has shifted from a technical comparison to a structural battle between **Capital Velocity** and **Distribution Moats**. Solana maintains its lead in raw throughput and speculative turnover, while Base is successfully capturing "sticky" retail and institutional onboarding through the Coinbase gateway.

### Core Trends: Performance vs. Distribution
Solana‚Äôs ecosystem is currently defined by **Execution Gravity**. The concentration of liquidity within high-performance trading terminals like **Trojan** and aggregators like **Jupiter** has turned the network into the world‚Äôs most efficient "Internet Capital Market." In 2025, Solana processed **33.13B non-vote transactions**, dwarfing every other chain and proving its dominance in high-frequency onchain activity.

Base, conversely, is riding the **BTC Liquidity and Consumer Abstraction** wave. The recent surge in **cbBTC** and BTC-restaking incentives (like the Bedrock 60,000 $OP pool) has turned Base into a primary sink for Bitcoin capital on L2. Simultaneously, the integration of **zk-based shielded payments** via Hinkal and wallet-level abstractions are positioning Base as the preferred venue for private, non-speculative commerce.

{chart_id:344}

### Comparative Sustainability and Moat Analysis
Solana‚Äôs moat is built on **Economic Inversion**. In 2025, Solana achieved a 600%+ app/chain fee ratio, where applications (Meteora, Pump.fun) captured over **$4 billion** while the chain itself took $650 million. This "thin protocol, thick app" model suggests a sustainable ecosystem where builders, not just the network, are highly profitable. However, its moat is under constant threat from "Parallel EVM" contenders like **Monad** and **MegaETH**, which target the same performance niche.

Base‚Äôs moat is **Vertical Distribution**. By integrating with Coinbase‚Äôs 108M+ verified users, Base has built a regulatory and onboarding wall that is nearly impossible to replicate. This "Fat Distribution" moat is arguably more sustainable; while raw performance can be commoditized, the **direct relationship with the end-user** (via the Coinbase wallet and Farcaster) is far stickier.

{chart_id:592}

### Metrics of Divergence
The 90-day data shows Base gaining aggressive ground in capitalization while Solana moderates:
*   **TVL Momentum**: Base TVL grew **~9.8%** to $6.01B, while Solana TVL saw a modest decline to **$8.9B**.
*   **Fee Generation**: Base protocol fees surged by **~40%**, primarily driven by **Uniswap** and **Aerodrome**, whereas Solana‚Äôs fees fell **34.5%** as activity shifted away from high-fee minting events.
*   **Liquidity Health**: Solana‚Äôs stablecoin market cap (dominated by USDC) dropped **18.3%** in 3 months to **$13.4B**, signaling a reduction in "idle" liquidity. Base's stablecoin cap remains steady or growing, supported by institutional trust.

{chart_id:522}

### The Moat Verdict
Solana is the **"Global Bazaar"**‚Äîthe most sustainable home for high-velocity capital and DePIN infrastructure due to its open competition and technical resilience. Base is the **"Corporate Mall"**‚Äîthe most sustainable venue for consumer adoption and "safe" financial services. Solana's moat is **deep but technically contested**; Base's moat is **wide but centrally dependent** on Coinbase's continued execution.

{image_id:451739}

question.query: analyze the defi market - which protocols are leading the narrative shift, gaining mindshare, and why

steps.text:
Short executive summary
- The DeFi narrative is shifting from ‚Äúpure speculation + yield farming‚Äù to three durable themes: (1) UX & scaling (ZK L2s + account abstraction); (2) omnichain composability (cross-chain messaging, unified liquidity); and (3) capital-efficiency / institutionalization (liquid staking + restaking, RWA, revenue-capture).  
- Protocols gaining the most mindshare are Uniswap (V4 / Unification / UniswapX), Aave (V3‚ÜíV4 lending primitives + RWA markets), Lido + EigenLayer (liquid staking + restaking), and cross-chain messaging stacks (LayerZero / Stargate / Wormhole / Axelar). ZK rollups and account-abstraction platforms (zkSync, Starknet, other ZK L2s) are the UX enablers accelerating adoption. Evidence: recent product launches, architecture changes and market metrics cited below.

Narratives and the protocols leading them (what‚Äôs changing and why)

1) UX & scaling ‚Äî ZK rollups + account abstraction
- Why it matters: lower gas, faster confirmations, native account abstraction (sponsored gas, session keys, batched UX) remove the onboarding friction that kept mainstream users and institutions out of DeFi.  
- Leaders: zkSync / Starknet / other ZK L2s pursuing native account abstraction; developer tooling (ERC‚Äë4337 vs native AA debates).  
- Why these have mindshare: clear product wins for retail UX and gas economics; projects and SDKs are shipping AA tooling and developer docs (see thirdweb/zk/ Staknet docs discussions). (sources: thirdweb AA primer, Starknet docs)

2) Omnichain / cross‚Äëchain composability
- Why it matters: liquidity and composability are moving off single chains. Protocols that make cross‚Äëchain calls safe, predictable and cheap let DeFi flows (liquidity, lending, derivatives) span many chains without fractured UX.  
- Leaders: LayerZero (omnichain semantics), Wormhole, Axelar and apps built on them (Stargate-style omnichain liquidity rails).  
- Why they‚Äôre winning mindshare: developer traction and integrations; ‚Äúomnichain‚Äù framing is replacing older ad-hoc bridging narratives because dense, predictable messaging reduces composability friction. (sources: LayerZero docs, cross‚Äëchain messaging roundups)

3) DEX & liquidity innovation ‚Äî Uniswap V4 / execution / MEV-aware routing
- Why it matters: Uniswap V4 introduces hooks, flash accounting, singleton pool models and native ETH handling ‚Äî enabling plugin-like pool logic, gas optimizations and new UX/merchant models. This lets teams build custom fee models, per‚Äëpool logic and revenue-sharing primitives.  
- Leaders: Uniswap (V4 + Unification proposal + UniswapX routing), plus protocols building on V4 hooks.  
- Why they‚Äôre winning: Uniswap remains the default liquidity layer; V4‚Äôs hooks create a whole new product surface for composability and monetizable on‚Äëchain features (see DWF Labs write‚Äëups and Uniswap blog posts). (sources: DWF Labs Uniswap V4 analysis; Uniswap blog / Unification)

4) Lending, credit and institutional markets ‚Äî Aave (V4), fixed-rate & native stablecoins
- Why it matters: lending is maturing from simple pooled variable-rate models to more modular architectures (hub & spoke, risk premiums, siloing, native stable issuance) and targeted RWA markets for institutional demand.  
- Leaders: Aave (V4 architecture, Risk Premiums, Horizon RWA market + GHO developments), Notional/Element/others for fixed-rate credit products.  
- Why they‚Äôre winning: Aave‚Äôs protocol-level design changes (hub/spoke, risk premiums) directly address scaling, capital fragmentation and risk pricing ‚Äî attractive to institutions and builders. (sources: Aave blog posts about V4 architecture and risk premiums; Aave changelog/Horizon market notes)

5) Liquid staking + restaking (capital efficiency)
- Why it matters: liquid staking turned locked staking into DeFi-native collateral; restaking (EigenLayer) lets staked ETH secure other services, layering yields without new capital. This dramatically increases capital efficiency and creates new composability primitives.  
- Leaders: Lido (largest liquid staking market share) and EigenLayer (restaking / AVS model).  
- Why they‚Äôre winning: Lido keeps large TVL and broad distribution (DefiLlama metrics); EigenLayer captures attention because restaking promises layered yield and new security models (coverage in QuickNode, CoinDesk and other writeups). (sources: DefiLlama Lido page; QuickNode and CoinDesk pieces on EigenLayer/restaking)

6) Real‚ÄëWorld Assets (RWA) & institutional yield
- Why it matters: tokenization of bonds, loans and other RWAs brings predictable, regulated yield to on‚Äëchain pools ‚Äî a bridge for institutional capital seeking yield that‚Äôs not purely crypto-native.  
- Leaders: Aave Horizon/other RWA markets, Centrifuge, Maple, Goldfinch and tokenization platforms.  
- Why they‚Äôre winning: regulatory clarity and tooling are improving, and protocols that can marry compliance with on‚Äëchain liquidity are getting institutional conversations. (sources: RWA tokenization roundups; Aave changelog announcing Horizon RWA market)

Other notable narratives
- Fixed‚Äërate and structured yield protocols (Pendle, Notional, Element) are gaining developer / trader mindshare as users want interest-rate primitives rather than only variable yields.  
- MEV & execution: MEV-aware execution (UniswapX, private routing) is central to advanced DEX UX and to protecting users from front-running while enabling better price outcomes. (see Uniswap reviews)

Concrete signals / evidence to watch
- TVL & fees: Lido‚Äôs TVL and fees are large (DefiLlama shows Lido as a dominant liquid staking player); EigenLayer and restaking TVL and operator adoption are the topline growth signals to follow.  
- Volume / swap execution: Uniswap V4 adoption metrics (V4 pools TVL, UniswapX volumes, protocol fees being turned on) indicate DEX narrative traction. (see Uniswap blog, DWF Labs analysis)  
- Aave markets: adoption of Aave V4 markets, GHO borrows and RWA volume are proxies for institutional lending demand (see Aave blog).  
- Cross‚Äëchain txs: number of protocols using LayerZero/Wormhole integrations and ‚Äúomnichain‚Äù products (Stargate-style token rails).

Implications for builders, traders and allocators
- Builders: prioritize UX (AA + sponsored gas + batched flows) and omnichain interoperability. Hooks/plugins (Uniswap V4-style) and composable revenue models are attractive to third‚Äëparty teams.  
- Traders/liquidity providers: Uniswap V4 changes pool economics ‚Äî monitor hook-enabled pools and fee structures. For yield, watch the interplay between liquid staking returns and restaking risk economics.  
- Allocators/institutions: RWA, native lending markets (Aave Horizon) and regulated on‚Äëramps to liquid staking/restaking are the ‚Äúinstitutional rails‚Äù to monitor. Fee‚Äërevenue capture (protocols turning on fees / buyback models) will shift fundamental valuations.

Risks and caveats
- Restaking/security tradeoffs: restaking introduces new slashing/complexity risks; monitor slashing models, operator economics and insurance/backstop mechanisms. (CoinDesk / QuickNode coverage)  
- Cross‚Äëchain risk: messaging/bridge exploits remain an outsized risk despite improved messaging semantics. Protocols built on cross‚Äëchain stacks inherit that risk.  
- Regulatory: tokenomics or fee-capture moves (e.g., Uniswap unification, turning on protocol fees) can attract regulatory attention or change token value dynamics.

Short recommended watchlist (next 3‚Äì6 months)
- Uniswap (V4 & Unification / UniswapX) ‚Äî impact on DEX UX and fees.  
- Aave (V4 / Horizon / GHO) ‚Äî lending architecture and RWA adoption.  
- Lido + EigenLayer ‚Äî liquid staking depth and restaking traction; watch TVL and operator integrations.  
- LayerZero + key integrators (Stargate-style apps) and Wormhole/Axelar ‚Äî cross‚Äëchain messaging adoption.  
- zkSync / Starknet and other ZK L2s ‚Äî account abstraction and UX changes that enable mass adoption.  
- Fixed-rate yield projects (Notional, Pendle, Element) and RWA platforms (Centrifuge, Maple) for new yield primitives.

If you want, I can:
- pull the latest TVL/volume/fee charts for the specific protocols above, or  
- draft a one‚Äëpage investor brief that ranks these narratives by investability/risk and lists on‚Äëchain metrics to monitor. Which would you prefer?

steps.text:
The DeFi market has moved past the "experimental" phase of 2020-2021 and is currently entering a cycle defined by **capital efficiency, institutional-grade yields, and the convergence of Bitcoin with smart contracts.**

The narrative has shifted from "printing tokens for liquidity" (DeFi 1.0) to "extracting maximum value from existing assets" (DeFi 3.0).

Here are the protocols leading the narrative shift and gaining significant mindshare:

---

### 1. The Restaking & Liquid Restaking (LRT) Narrative
This is arguably the dominant narrative of 2024. It focuses on "Security-as-a-Service," allowing users to stake their ETH to secure other networks (AVS) for additional yield.

*   **Leading Protocols:** **EigenLayer** (Infrastructure), **Ether.fi**, **Renzo**, and **Puffer Finance**.
*   **Why they are winning:**
    *   **Yield on Yield:** Investors are no longer satisfied with the ~3.5% base ETH staking yield. LRTs allow them to layer rewards (Staking + Restaking + Points/Airdrops).
    *   **Capital Efficiency:** Ether.fi and Renzo provide "Liquid" tokens (e.g., eETH), allowing users to remain liquid and use their restaked ETH in other DeFi protocols like Pendle.
*   **Mindshare Gain:** EigenLayer has become the third-largest protocol by TVL (Total Value Locked) in record time, proving that the market craves productive use of ETH.

### 2. The Yield Speculation & RWA Integration Narrative
Real World Assets (RWA) are bringing U.S. Treasury yields on-chain, while other protocols allow users to speculate on those yields.

*   **Leading Protocols:** **Ondo Finance**, **Pendle Finance**, and **Ethena**.
*   **Why they are winning:**
    *   **Ondo:** It has bridged the gap between TradFi and DeFi by putting BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL fund and T-Bills on-chain. It is seen as the "institutional beta" for the RWA narrative.
    *   **Pendle:** Pendle has seen an explosion in mindshare because it allows users to "tokenize yield." In a points-heavy market, Pendle lets users sell their future yield for immediate cash or "leverage" their points, making it the premier playground for sophisticated DeFi users.
    *   **Ethena:** By creating USDe (a synthetic dollar), Ethena provides a "Delta-Neutral" yield that significantly outperforms traditional stablecoins, attracting billions in capital from yield-hungry investors.

### 3. The BTCFi (Bitcoin DeFi) Narrative
Bitcoin is no longer just a "store of value." The narrative shift is toward making the $1.3T Bitcoin market cap productive.

*   **Leading Protocols:** **Babylon**, **Stacks (STX)**, and **Solv Protocol**.
*   **Why they are winning:**
    *   **Babylon:** It allows Bitcoin holders to stake their BTC to secure PoS chains. This is the "EigenLayer for Bitcoin" and is currently one of the most anticipated infrastructure plays.
    *   **Stacks:** With the Nakamoto upgrade, Stacks is positioning itself as the leading Bitcoin L2, bringing smart contract functionality to the original blockchain.
*   **Mindshare Gain:** As Ethereum L2s become crowded, the "untapped liquidity" of Bitcoin is seen as the next frontier for massive growth.

### 4. The Solana DeFi Renaissance
Solana has moved from "post-FTX recovery" to a legitimate DeFi powerhouse that competes with Ethereum on UX and speed.

*   **Leading Protocols:** **Jupiter (JUP)** and **Jito (JTO)**.
*   **Why they are winning:**
    *   **Jupiter:** It isn't just a DEX aggregator; it's a full-stack financial suite (Swap, Perps, Launchpad). Its UX is arguably the best in crypto, making it the primary entry point for Solana users.
    *   **Jito:** By integrating MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) rewards into liquid staking, Jito has captured the mindshare of Solana validators and stakers, becoming the backbone of Solana's capital efficiency.
*   **Narrative Shift:** DeFi is moving toward "App-chains" and high-performance monoliths where the transaction costs are negligible, enabling high-frequency trading and sophisticated strategies.

### 5. Modular & Intent-Centric DeFi
The industry is moving away from users manually clicking buttons on multiple bridges and DEXs toward "Intents."

*   **Leading Protocols:** **Uniswap (v4/UniswapX)** and **CowSwap**.
*   **Why they are winning:**
    *   **CowSwap:** By using "Solvers" to find the best price and protect against MEV, CowSwap is gaining mindshare among whales who want to avoid slippage and front-running.
    *   **Narrative Shift:** The "Intent-Centric" shift means users simply state what they want (e.g., "I want 1 ETH for the best price"), and the protocol handles the complex routing behind the scenes.

---

### Summary Table: Why the Narrative is Shifting

| Narrative | Leading Protocol | Core Catalyst |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Restaking** | **EigenLayer** | Shared security; maximizing ETH productivity. |
| **BTCFi** | **Babylon** | Unlocking $1.3 Trillion in idle BTC capital. |
| **Yield Trading** | **Pendle** | Tokenizing future yield and points; "DeFi Legos." |
| **RWAs** | **Ondo** | Low-risk institutional yields (T-Bills) on-chain. |
| **Synthetic Dollars** | **Ethena** | Scalable, high-yield stablecoins independent of banks. |

### Conclusion
The market is currently rewarding **yield complexity** and **institutional alignment.** If a protocol can either:
1.  Make your existing assets (ETH/BTC) earn more yield via restaking, or 
2.  Provide a seamless bridge to institutional assets (RWAs),

...it is winning the mindshare battle. The "Narrative Shift" is fundamentally a move toward **Capital Efficiency**‚Äîmaking every dollar in the system work 24/7.

2.  Provide a seamless bridge to institutional assets (RWAs),

...it is winning the mindshare battle. The "Narrative Shift" is fundamentally a move toward **Capital Efficiency**‚Äîmaking every dollar in the system work 24/7.

The DeFi market is transitioning from purely incentive-driven "farming" to institutional-grade rails and an agentic economy where AI handles execution. Mindshare is concentrating in protocols that provide real revenue capture, BTC yield, and autonomous trading.

### The Agentic Economy: AI-First DeFi
The most aggressive mindshare shift is toward "Agentic DeFi," where AI agents like **Dexter** are replacing manual UI interactions. Dexter has become the largest facilitator for **x402 payments** on Solana, with transactions rising **700% WoW** and annualizing toward $600M in volume. This isn't just a gimmick; it‚Äôs the commercialization of AI-led onchain commerce.

{chart_id:353}

Protocols are shifting to support this by enabling "Prompt-to-DeFi" infrastructure. For instance, **Infinit Labs** and **Virtuals (Butler)** allow users to execute complex strategies via natural language, which settled $3.72M in volume through Dexter's facilitator recently. The "why" is simple: agents can manage risk and optimize yield 24/7 with zero latency compared to human traders.

### BTCFi: Unlocking the Prime Collateral
Bitcoin is no longer idle. **Lombard** has seized the BTCFi narrative, commanding a **57% market share** in Bitcoin liquid staking. Its LBTC token achieved $1 billion in TVL in just 92 days‚Äîthe fastest of any yield-bearing asset in history. By acquiring the **BTC.b infrastructure** from Ava Labs, Lombard has consolidated the rails for Bitcoin across 13 chains.

{image_id:447872}

The utilization rate for LBTC stands at **82%**, meaning the capital isn't just sitting; it‚Äôs being cycled through Aave, Morpho, and Pendle for stacked yield. This shift turns BTC into "prime collateral" comparable to ETH, but with a larger total addressable market. **Meteora** is also capturing this trend on Solana, seeing a **3.01% revenue growth** over the last 30 days as a primary liquidity hub.

### The Stablecoin Revenue Meta
The stablecoin narrative has shifted from "safe haven" to "productive asset." **Usual** and the **Stable L1** (backed by Bitfinex and Franklin Templeton) are leading this "Revenue Meta." They utilize **USDT0** as native gas, capturing yield from Real World Assets (RWAs) and redistributing it via buybacks or revenue sharing.

*   **Usual**: +2.06% revenue growth over 30 days, positioning as a "DeFi Mullet" (institutional backend, retail frontend).
*   **Hyperliquid**: Executed a **$910M HYPE buyback**, proving that fee-capture derivatives are the new valuation benchmark.
*   **Lombard**: Chosen as the canonical BTC partner for the Stable L1, further bridging BTC liquidity into the revenue-sharing ecosystem.

Base is showing the healthiest growth in this category, with a **5.88% monthly TVL increase**, driven by lending protocols like **Morpho** which now holds **$2.235B in TVL**. The narrative is clear: if a protocol doesn't have a sustainable revenue-sharing or buyback model, it‚Äôs losing mindshare to the yield-bearing "productive" cohort.

question.query: Looking at the top perps protocols, what are the key trends and catalysts? Is narrative momentum accelerating, decelerating, or stable?

steps.text:
Short answer
- Overall momentum for perpetuals (especially on‚Äëchain perp DEXs) has been accelerating through 2024‚Äì2025 ‚Äî volumes, product launches and new entrants surged ‚Äî but by late‚Äë2025 the market is shifting from explosive growth to a more competitive/maturing phase. In other words: strong positive momentum, but the pace of acceleration is moderating as winners emerge and incentives/competition normalize.

Key trends (what‚Äôs happening)
- Massive on‚Äëchain volume growth: perp DEX volumes spiked in 2025 (record monthly/trimestral volumes reported), driven by liquidations, high leverage trading and incentive programs. (See The Block / CoinDesk reporting on 2025 perp DEX volume highs.)
- New winners & rapid market share turnover: a small set of new native perp DEXs (e.g., Hyperliquid and other newer chains/projects) quickly grabbed large share, but have also faced share erosion as competitors (Aster, Lighter, established players) iterate. (Coverage in The Block / CoinDesk, 2025.)
- Product evolution ‚Äî better UX & primitives:
  - Hybrid models (off‚Äëchain matching + on‚Äëchain settlement) and purpose chains (dYdX Chain / v4) enabled pro trading features with fast execution.
  - More sophisticated margin options (cross‚Äëmargin, isolated markets), advanced order types and deeper risk tools (insurance funds, dynamic liquidation engines).
  - Improvements in AMM designs (vAMM tweaks, concentrated liquidity for perps) and cross‚Äëmargin liquidity aggregation.
- Cross‚Äëchain & infra improvements: rollups, app‚Äëspecific chains and faster bridges lowered costs and latency, making on‚Äëchain perps more competitive with CeFi derivatives.
- Incentives & tokenomics matter again: aggressive fee rebates, token rewards and buyback/burn or revenue‚Äëshare policies are major liquidity/volume drivers.
- Regulatory pressure on CeFi derivatives (and general scrutiny) has been a tailwind for decentralized alternatives, attracting some flows that previously went to centralized futures desks.
- Consolidation & focus on business sustainability: after initial subsidy-driven growth, teams and governors emphasize revenue capture, buybacks and sustainable incentives (e.g., dYdX governance updates).

Primary catalysts (what will move narrative next)
- Crypto market volatility / big bull runs (BTC/ETH) ‚Äî spikes in volatility drive perp volume and leverage use.
- New incentive programs and tokenomics changes (rewards/fee rebates, buybacks) ‚Äî can quickly re‚Äëaccelerate volumes.
- Infrastructure launches/upgrades (dYdX Chain features, L2/perf improvements, cross‚Äëchain integrations) that materially lower execution cost/latency.
- Regulatory actions or clarity in major jurisdictions ‚Äî could accelerate migration from centralized venues or, conversely, constrain growth if DeFi faces heavy enforcement.
- Institutional integration (custody, compliance rails) ‚Äî if mid/senior institutional flows access DeFi perps safely, that‚Äôs a major growth inflection.
- Liquidation storms / leverage events ‚Äî one big liquidation cascade can produce short‚Äëterm volume spikes and shift trader perceptions of safety.

Signals I‚Äôd watch (leading indicators)
- On‚Äëchain perp DEX traded volume and open interest (7‚Äë/30‚Äëday trends).
- Funding rates and average leverage across protocols.
- New trader growth and retention: unique trader addresses and repeat trading share.
- Protocol revenue / fee capture and governance actions (incentive changes, buybacks).
- Market‚Äëshare shifts between the top 5 perp protocols.
- Number and size of large liquidations and insurance fund balances.
- Regulatory headlines (major enforcement, exchange bans, or favorable frameworks).

Narrative verdict (one line)
- Momentum = accelerating overall (strong growth in on‚Äëchain perpetuals through 2024‚Äì25), but the rate of acceleration is decelerating as the space moves from incentive‚Äëled expansion to product competition, margin optimization and consolidation. Winners are being determined; expect continued volume growth but more selective narratives and shorter, sharper cycles tied to incentives and market volatility.

If you want, I can:
- Pull live on‚Äëchain metrics (volume, OI, funding rate) for the top 6 perps (dYdX, GMX, Perpetual Protocol, Synthetix perps, Hyperliquid, others) and show recent market‚Äëshare trends.
- Track a 6‚Äì12 month view of incentives and governance changes that shifted volumes.
